column4: Uhm, Can I get some help? :\ (i'm on the live CD) I keep getting this error: ""The resize operation has been aborted."
I don't know where else to go :\
Uhm, Can I get some help? :\ (i'm on the live CD) I keep getting this error: ""The resize operation has been aborted."
anyone know how to get past the error i'm getting? I cant even install ubuntu ._.
I missed it .. what's the error
(i'm on the live CD) I keep getting this error: ""The resize operation has been aborted."
you trying to dual boot with vista?
nope
can we private chat? XD
no.. better here
okay uhm, well I was recently running wubi, and I decided to install ubuntu (this is on my backup D:\ drive)
So I unisntalled wubi, and when I went to install ubuntu, It kept telling me it couldnt write the changes D=
any idea Scunizi ? :\
k.. so you have 2 drives.. in the live cd in system>admin>partition editor  .. try that .. you might have to delete the partitions on that drive and recreate them
wait WAIT, D= But D:\ has all of my backup data on it ._.
ok.. then use the same program to shrink the partition that is there then create 3 new ones for ubuntu
I get  "An error occurred while applying the operations"
is this an sata drive?
yea...
It is a SATA drive...

there's a couple of things that I can think of that might work.. these are the only two things that I can come up with .. there's probably lots more.. but first you might be suffering the "bug" with reading some harddrives architecture.  the second is much easier to test.  on the first screen that comes up on the live cd, hit f6 and erase "quiet splash" from the end of the kernel line and add "pci=nomsi" then hit enter and attemp
do I restart me pc to get back to the startup screen? xD
yes
